entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character in the story. He is mentioned as saying 'We did it!' and is described as being breathless.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is a person who has gone on Buckbeak, according to Harry. He is not physically present in the scene.

entities.name: buckbeak
entities.description: Buckbeak is an animal that Sirius has gone on. It is mentioned as a mode of transportation.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the headmaster who beamed at Harry and Hermione. He is described as listening intently for any sound within the hospital wing.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is a person who is with Harry in the story. She is mentioned as slipping back inside the dormitory and tucking the Time-Turner under her robes.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a person who is lying motionless in the end bed. He is mentioned as being still there when Harry and Hermione return to their own beds.

entities.name: madam pomfrey
entities.description: Madam Pomfrey is a person who comes out of her office and asks if she can look after her patients now. She is described as being in a bad mood.

entities.name: time-turner
entities.description: The Time-Turner is an object that Hermione tucks under her robes. It is mentioned as being hidden from view.

relationships.description: Harry and Sirius are related by the fact that Sirius has gone on Buckbeak, according to Harry.
Dumbledore beamed at Harry in the story. This is a physical action that shows their relationship.
Madam Pomfrey stood over Hermione, making sure she ate the chocolate. This is a physical action that shows their relationship.
Harry and the Time-Turner are related by the fact that Hermione tucked it under her robes, hiding it from view.
